scene information.what: Arthur, a meticulous graphic designer who values his quiet routine, invited his old college friend Finn and Finn's new girlfriend, Luna, for a 'weekend catch-up.' It's now Friday of the following week, and the 'weekend' has stretched into nine days. The living room, once a sanctuary of minimalist design, is now cluttered with their suitcases, forgotten clothes, and empty snack wrappers. Finn is sprawled on the couch, watching a loud action movie on Arthur's TV, while Luna is painting her nails at Arthur's antique coffee table, occasionally flicking polish chips onto the rug. Arthur walks in, holding a bill for an unusually high energy consumption, a strained smile on his face, trying to find a polite way to bring up their departure.

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: (Forced cheerfulness) Hey guys. Enjoying the... the show, Finn?

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: (Without looking away, a slow blink) Mmm, yeah... this explosion scene... it's quite something. Your TV is, well, it's really impressive, man.

scene.speaker: Luna
scene.content: (Waving a freshly painted nail) Arthur, your coffee table is simply divine. Perfect for a mani-pedi session.

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: (Holding up the bill, a tight smile) Fantastic. Speaking of things running, I just got this. Our energy consumption seems to have... skyrocketed.

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: (Shrugging) Oh, well, you know, we're here. More lights, more charging, more movie nights!

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: Right. It just made me think, with your travel plans... are you still looking at sometime this weekend? Or early next week?

scene.speaker: Luna
scene.content: Oh, we haven't quite ironed out the specifics yet, have we, honey? Travel is so fluid these days.

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: Yeah, no rush. We're chilling, you're chilling. It's a proper vacation vibe!

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: (His smile falters slightly) Right. A vacation. For sure.

scene information.what: Arthur wakes up early, hoping to make his special artisanal coffee before his morning client call. He enters the kitchen to find a disaster zone: unwashed dishes piled high in the sink, splatters of what looks like pancake batter on the pristine white counter, and Luna, humming off-key, using his expensive, rare single-origin coffee beans to brew an enormous, weak pot for herself and Finn, having already emptied half the bag. She's also left a frying pan soaking, blocking the sink. Arthur, usually calm, feels a vein throb in his temple as he sees his carefully curated kitchen become a functional nightmare. He finally snaps, his voice low but laced with barely suppressed anger.

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: (Voice low, strained) Luna. What is all this?

scene.speaker: Luna
scene.content: (Humming, oblivious at first) Good morning, Arthur! Pancake remnants, mostly. We had a feast.

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: My beans. My rare, single-origin beans. You've used... half the bag. For this weak, giant pot?

scene.speaker: Luna
scene.content: Oh, yes! Finn and I just love coffee. We ran out of our own, so I thought, why not? Sharing is caring.

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: And the sink? The frying pan soaking, blocking everything? This isn't sharing, Luna. This is... a complete disregard for my space. My home.

scene.speaker: Luna
scene.content: It's just a few dishes, Arthur. And I was trying to make us all coffee. You're overreacting. It's just a kitchen.

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: It's not 'just a kitchen.' It's my kitchen. And I need to use it. Now. This instant.

scene information.what: It's been two weeks. Arthur's deadline for a major design project is looming, and he desperately needs his gaming room, which doubles as his creative retreat with a powerful workstation. He finds Finn entirely entrenched in the room, surrounded by an impressive array of energy drink cans, fast-food wrappers, and what appears to be a sleeping bag on the floor next to Arthur's high-end gaming PC. Finn is mid-game, wearing Arthur's expensive noise-canceling headphones, completely oblivious. Arthur has had enough. His quiet, polite demeanor has vanished, replaced by a steely resolve. He strides in, yanks the power cord from the wall, and stands over a startled Finn, finally laying down the law.

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: (Standing over Finn, eyes blazing) Finn. That's enough.

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: (Startled, pulling off headphones slowly) Whoa! Arthur... what... what happened? I was just about to beat this boss!

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: This is my workspace. My gaming room. And I need it. Now.

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: Yeah, I know. Just a few more minutes? I'm so close. We can share, right?

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: No. We can't. Your 'weekend' visit has stretched into two weeks. You and Luna need to leave.

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: Leave...? What do you... mean? We just... got comfortable here. Are you... seriously saying that right now?

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: Completely serious. You have until tomorrow evening. You need to pack up and be out of my apartment by then.

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: Tomorrow? That's so sudden! Where are we supposed to go?

scene.speaker: Arthur
scene.content: That is no longer my concern. Figure it out. Tell Luna. Just be gone.

scene.speaker: Finn
scene.content: (Reluctantly, seeing Arthur's resolved face) Alright, alright. I'll talk to Luna. But this is... wow.
